RefactorHub is a commit annotator for refactoring.

result.name: RefactorHub 2.0: Refactoring Highlighter, Untangler and Annotator
result.description:
![image](https://github.com/salab/RefactorHub/assets/54635893/0d854c18-d385-4aca-9f47-12de8fef1c42)
## New Features
* Highlight common token sequences before and after changes to provide hints on refactoring locations
* Divide large changes with multiple atomic changes mixed in one place
* Display multiple source code windows
* Tree view of modified files

result.value:
1. Create OAuth App [here](https://github.com/settings/developers) with `http://localhost:8080` as callback URL, and get `CLIENT_ID` and `CLIENT_SECRET`.
2. Generate access token [here](https://github.com/settings/tokens), and get `GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN`.
3. Set `CLIENT_ID`, `CLIENT_SECRET`, and `GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN` on `.env` file.
4. `docker-compose up`
5. Open http://localhost:8080
Open the new created Experiment, and annotate refactorings.
After annotation, click "RESULT" button on the Experiment page.
